body.value:
Personalized care for women’s reproductive cancers

You’ll find a dedicated, supportive team on your side at Gynecology Oncology Clinic at UW Medical Center.

We offer comprehensive assessment and treatment of cancers and pre-invasive disease in a woman’s reproductive system, including uterine, cervical, vaginal, endometrial, ovarian and vulvar cancers and gestational trophoblastic disease. Our providers are highly specialized and are involved in innovative research and the development of new cancer treatments that may improve your specific treatment.

We know that choosing a provider is a very personal decision, and at Gynecology Oncology Clinic at UWMC our compassionate care team is ready to put a customized treatment plan in place for you.

attributes.title: Maternal Fetal Medicine Clinic at Yakima

body.value:
Specialized care for expecting mothers with complicated pregnancies

The Maternal Fetal Medicine Clinic brings world-class maternal care to Yakima families. We offer highly specialized care for women with health conditions or special challenges that may complicate pregnancy and birth.

Our team helps women with prematurity prevention and multiple births. We also offer prenatal care for women with diabetes, hypertension or other complex medical conditions and provide prenatal screening and diagnosis of genetic conditions.

The maternal fetal medicine specialists at the Yakima clinic also work at UW Medical Center and you’ll have the full resources of UWMC at your disposal, if needed, including the region’s premier neonatal intensive care unit.

Our compassionate, dedicated specialists will help you with all of your high-risk pregnancy needs.

Conveniently located for families in the Snohomish and Skagit Counties, the Maternal Fetal Medicine Clinic at Arlington offers highly specialized care for women with health conditions or special challenges that may complicate pregnancy and birth.

Our programs help women with prematurity prevention and multiple births. We also provide prenatal screening and diagnosis of genetic conditions and offer prenatal care for women with diabetes, hypertension or other complex medical conditions.

The maternal fetal medicine specialists at the Arlington clinic also work at UW Medical Center, and you’ll have the full resources of UWMC at your disposal, if needed, for your delivery, including the region’s premier neonatal intensive care unit.

Come see us and meet our team of compassionate, dedicated specialists who will help you with your high-risk pregnancy needs.

attributes.title: Meridian Women's Health at Northwest Outpatient Medical Center

body.value:
Personalized care for all women, located in North Seattle

Conveniently located in North Seattle, Meridian Women's Health at Northwest Outpatient Medical Center provides a full range of obstetrics and gynecology care, from wellness exams to pregnancy care to the latest in minimally invasive surgery. Our services also include family planning, nutritional counseling, management of menopausal issues, and screenings for early detection and treatment of many gynecologic problems.

We work with you to develop an individually tailored care plan that includes your physical, emotional, social and spiritual health.

At Meridian Women's Health at Northwest Outpatient Medical Center, we believe women deserve the best that is available in modern medicine combined with clear communication and education.

body.value:
The Foster Care Clinic offers primary care and consultations for foster children with medical, behavioral and other special health care needs.

Our team consists of a pediatrician, nurse and social worker. Each visit at our clinic allows for the extra time needed to provide the best care and communication with foster families.

The Foster Care Clinic works with the Children and Teen’s Clinic at Harborview to provide same-day appointments for sick children.

Clinic services include well-baby and well-child checkups for children in foster care (EPSDT) and immunizations; continuity healthcare for children while in dependency; 24-hour phone access to trained nurses for acute medical issues; medical care for acute illnesses; consultation for children with developmental, behavioral or medical concerns; coordination and referral for specialty medical, dental and mental health services; screening for fetal alcohol syndrome; foster family counseling regarding behavioral and parenting concerns; mental health consultation and coordination with community mental health agencies; interpreting and coordinating medical records and communication with child welfare and adoption caseworkers, court, schools, daycares, therapists and counselors.

body.value:
Critical newborn care from experienced, dedicated staff

For more than 50 years, the UW Medicine Level IV neonatal intensive care unit - one of the largest in the Pacific Northwest - has provided the highest level of care for the most fragile newborns and their families.

Our expert team brings extensive experience and great compassion in caring for multiple births and micro preemies - babies born before 26 weeks gestation or weighing less than 2.2 pounds.

Our team works with parents to plan each baby’s care. We’ll be there every step of the way, teaching and supporting you as you make this journey with your baby.

body.value:
Complete care for infants, children and teens

Conveniently located in Seattle’s University District, the Pediatric Care Center provides comprehensive primary and specialty care for babies, children and young people to age 21.

Our services include well-child checkups, developmental screenings, care for acute illnesses, gynecologic care, school and sports evaluations, environmental health consults, guidance on behavioral and parenting concerns, and hearing and vision screenings.  We also offer interpreter services for non-English speaking families.

Same-day appointments are available for sick kids. A 24-hour nurse phone line is available when you need immediate care assistance.

Unique expertise in adoption medicine

The Pediatric Care Center is also home to the Center for Adoption Medicine, which provides pre-adoption consultations, on-call travel support, post-placement evaluations, and ongoing medical care for fostered and adopted children.  Our pediatricians have unique expertise in the field of adoption medicine and in the diagnosis of Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASDs).

body.value:
Vital care for women of all ages

The Women’s Clinic at Harborview provides family planning, pregnancy and gynecological care to women of all ages.

We work in teams that include doctors from the UW School of Medicine, psychiatrists, nurse practitioners, registered nurses, residents (licensed physicians receiving advanced training), pharmacists, medical assistants, social workers, nutritionists, cultural case managers and interpreters.

Our prenatal care takes place at Harborview, and we deliver babies at UW Medical Center where our physicians are on staff. Maternity Support Services (MSS) and psychiatric consultations are also available at the Women's Clinic. In addition, we offer a full array of birth control options, including birth control pills and intrauterine devices.

The Women’s Clinic at Harborview provides services designed for the special needs of immigrants and refugees.  We have Spanish-speaking providers and offer interpreter services for non-English speaking families as well as assistance dealing with health insurance paperwork and problems.

attributes.title: Women's Health Clinic at Mill Creek

body.value:
New location for comprehensive women's healthcare in Mill Creek

​At Women's Health Clinic at Mill Creek, our board-certified providers and knowledgeable support staff are dedicated to working with each woman to develop an individually tailored care plan that takes into account not only your physical health but the emotional, social and spiritual needs that relate to your overall well-being. We cover a wide range of obstetrical and gynecological specialties from basic wellness exams to the latest in minimally invasive surgeries. As part of Northwest Hospital & Medical Center, we have access to state-of-the-art technology provided in a comfortable community hospital setting.

For our maternity care patients, deliveries take place at the Childbirth Center at Northwest Hospital & Medical Center.​

attributes.title: Women's Health Care Center at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
Personalized, comprehensive care just for women

The experienced physicians and nurse practitioners at the Women’s Health Care Center at UWMC-Roosevelt offer a wide array of primary and specialty healthcare services that address the unique health needs of women.

We emphasize wellness and prevention and encourage you to become a partner in your healthcare. Our services include well-woman exams, complete OB/GYN care, help with menopause, mental health services and social work guidance.  We also offer breast care services, including mammography and breast imaging.

We invite women of all ages to come see us. Our goal is to partner with you for a lifetime of health and wellness.

attributes.title: Women's Cancer Care of Seattle at Northwest Hospital

body.value:
Personalized cancer care and support in North Seattle

Conveniently located in North Seattle, Women's Cancer Care of Seattle at Northwest Hospital & Medical Center combines the expertise of two of the region's leading gynecologic oncologists with an experienced, caring team of nurses, technicians and staff to provide the most advanced prevention and treatment available for gynecologic cancers. Cancers treated include uterine, endometrial, ovarian, cervical, peritoneal, tubal, vaginal, vulvar and gestational trophoblastic neoplasia.

We are dedicated to achieving positive results and carefully explore all options for state-of-the-art treatment plans, including minimally invasive surgery, chemotherapy and research protocols, or other innovative procedures.

We build close relationships with our patients through clear communication and empower them to play an active role in making decisions about their own care.

Personalized cancer care and support in North Seattle

attributes.title: Sexual Assault and Traumatic Stress Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Comprehensive evaluations and compassionate care

Led by an experienced, integrative team, the Center for Sexual Assault and Traumatic Stress offers a wide range of services, including:

Medical/forensic services

  • 24/7 availability of care for sexual assault through the Harborview ED as well as 24/7 access to medical forensic consultation on sexual assault and child abuse.
  • Scheduled non-acute child sexual abuse exams and ED follow up appointments in our clinic.
  • Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner (SANE) program where patients can receive expert medical forensic and psychosocial care at the UW Medicine location of choice.

Therapy services

  • Psychosocial treatments are available for children, families and adults affected by child maltreatment, sexual assault, crime and other traumas. Treatments can be brief, educational and supportive interventions or may involve a course of evidence-based therapy. Treatment is tailored to the needs of the patient and family. The evidence-based therapies that are available include trauma-specific cognitive behavioral therapies (CBT), CBT for children with sexual behavior problems, and behavior management therapy including specific models to reduce risk of violence or abuse.
  • Expert counselors are available to provide brief case consultation to the public and professionals on sexual assault, child maltreatment and trauma.

Foster Care Assessment Program (FCAP)

  • FCAP provides comprehensive evaluations for foster children to identify barriers to reunification or adoption so that foster children do not languish. The evaluation addresses emotional and behavior problems in children, psychiatric and substance abuse concerns in parents, parenting needs, and child educational and functioning status.
body.processed:
Comprehensive evaluations and compassionate care

Led by an experienced, integrative team, the Center for Sexual Assault and Traumatic Stress offers a wide range of services, including:

Medical/forensic services

  • 24/7 availability of care for sexual assault through the Harborview ED as well as 24/7 access to medical forensic consultation on sexual assault and child abuse.
  • Scheduled non-acute child sexual abuse exams and ED follow up appointments in our clinic.
  • Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner (SANE) program where patients can receive expert medical forensic and psychosocial care at the UW Medicine location of choice.

Therapy services

  • Psychosocial treatments are available for children, families and adults affected by child maltreatment, sexual assault, crime and other traumas. Treatments can be brief, educational and supportive interventions or may involve a course of evidence-based therapy. Treatment is tailored to the needs of the patient and family. The evidence-based therapies that are available include trauma-specific cognitive behavioral therapies (CBT), CBT for children with sexual behavior problems, and behavior management therapy including specific models to reduce risk of violence or abuse.
  • Expert counselors are available to provide brief case consultation to the public and professionals on sexual assault, child maltreatment and trauma.

Foster Care Assessment Program (FCAP)

  • FCAP provides comprehensive evaluations for foster children to identify barriers to reunification or adoption so that foster children do not languish. The evaluation addresses emotional and behavior problems in children, psychiatric and substance abuse concerns in parents, parenting needs, and child educational and functioning status.

body.value:
Comprehensive fertility care for men and women

Located in Seattle’s University District, Reproductive Care at UWMC-Roosevelt offers comprehensive, compassionate and personalized care for men and women who are trying to conceive a child. The clinic also provides welcoming care for single women, same-sex couples and LGBTQ persons wanting to conceive.

Our unique approach to fertility involves caring for the needs of couples as well as individuals. Our highly trained specialists can handle the entire spectrum of reproductive issues, from contraception to infertility to hormone replacement therapy. We also specialize in fertility preservation in clients with cancer or those facing treatments that may jeopardize their future fertility.

We can also provide seamless, coordinated obstetric care with UW Medicine providers who have experience with high-risk pregnancies.

body.value:
A coordinated approach for all pelvic health conditions

The Pelvic Health Center provides comprehensive, compassionate and patient-centered care for simple and complex pelvic floor conditions.

We bring together specialists from a variety of services, including female urology, urogynecology, colorectal surgery, gastroenterology, physical therapy and rehabilitation so that each patient gets the individualized medical or surgical care they need.

Staffed by nationally recognized and board-certified professionals, we are dedicated to giving you the finest care available for any pelvic floor disorder and offer services at both UW Medical Center and the Eastside Specialty Center in Bellevue.

body.value:
Full-spectrum care, centrally located at Harborview

When you and your family need high-quality, comprehensive healthcare, visit the Family Medicine Clinic at Harborview. We offer personalized medicine that includes preventive care, as well as evaluation and treatment of acute and chronic illnesses.

Our healthcare professionals are board-certified in family medicine and treat patients of all ages. Family physicians are specialists who complete a residency in family medicine. They receive broad training beyond general medicine in obstetrics, gynecology, pediatrics, internal medicine, surgery, psychiatry and geriatrics.

Our healthcare professionals provide a range of services including pregnancy tests, prenatal care, family planning, well-child exams, immunizations, hearing and vision screenings, psychiatric consultations, medication management and recommendations for continued psychiatric care.

The care team accepts most major insurance plans. Make your appointment today.

The care team accepts most major insurance plans. Make your appointment today.

attributes.title: Audiology Services at Harborview Medical Center

body.value:
Complete hearing testing and hearing aid services at Harborview

Audiology Services at Harborview Medical Center offers its patients complete hearing testing and hearing aid services.

Located within Harborview's Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery Clinic, Audiology Services also offers patient care coordination to assist with referrals, insurance and general questions, along with coordination of care and services for the patient’s individual hearing needs.

attributes.title: Infant Development Follow-up Clinic at UWMC

body.value:
Care for children at risk for developmental problems

The Infant Development Follow-up Clinic at UWMC provides care for children from birth to age 5 who are at high risk for developmental problems due to prematurity, low birth weight or prenatal exposure to drugs.

Our goal is to provide early identification and referral for early intervention for children at risk for neurodevelopmental and neurobehavioral problems. Our team of experts works together to assess each child’s health and development and connect families with resources if problems are found.

For appointments, call 206.598.9348.
body.processed:
Care for children at risk for developmental problems

The Infant Development Follow-up Clinic at UWMC provides care for children from birth to age 5 who are at high risk for developmental problems due to prematurity, low birth weight or prenatal exposure to drugs.

Our goal is to provide early identification and referral for early intervention for children at risk for neurodevelopmental and neurobehavioral problems. Our team of experts works together to assess each child’s health and development and connect families with resources if problems are found.

For appointments, call 206.598.9348.

body.value:
The best place to begin your motherhood journey

The Childbirth Center at Northwest Hospital provides the finest care for expecting mothers and newborns in a setting designed to support your entire birth experience. Our experienced team of obstetricians and certified nurse midwives offer expert care before, during and after the birth of your child. We believe that you, your partner and your support people are the most important members of your care team, and we want to ensure you’re able to share this unforgettable experience with your family and loved ones.

We invite you to tour the Childbirth Center. And if you take the tour and decide to give birth at our facility, you’ll receive all of the information and support you need to prepare you for the adventure of pregnancy, delivery, postpartum care and bringing your new baby home.

We look forward to meeting you and sharing your journey.

body.value:
Urologic, sexual and reproductive healthcare for men in the University District

The Men’s Health Center at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt emphasizes urologic, sexual and reproductive care involving a wide range of conditions.

Our physicians and staff are experienced in advanced medical therapies and minimally invasive procedures. And as part of the UW Medicine health system, we also can connect patients with cardiology, endocrinology and other specialists.

Our clinic provides men a private, supportive environment where various conditions can be evaluated and treated. Our hope is that men will also become more knowledgeable about, and involved in, their overall health.

For immediate fertility preservation help, call 206-314-5268.

Urologic, sexual and reproductive healthcare for men in the University District

Our physicians and staff are experienced in advanced medical therapies and minimally invasive procedures. And as part of the UW Medicine health system, we also can connect patients with cardiology, endocrinology and other specialists.

Our clinic provides men a private, supportive environment where various conditions can be evaluated and treated. Our hope is that men will also become more knowledgeable about, and involved in, their overall health.

For immediate fertility preservation help, call 206-314-5268.

body.value:
Specialized expertise for mothers-to-be

Midwives are healthcare professionals who specialize in assisting healthy, uncomplicated births. At the Northwest Hospital Midwives Clinic, our certified nurse-midwives (CNMs) are advanced registered nurse practitioners (ARNPs) with graduate degrees in nurse-midwifery and who have passed a national certification exam.

Our experienced team has delivered thousands of babies, and they help guide families through the life-changing experience of pregnancy and birth.

Midwives approach birth as a holistic journey, collaborating with each woman to create a personalized birth plan in keeping with individual values, cultural preferences and medical considerations.

We invite you to visit our clinic when you are beginning your journey to motherhood.

attributes.title: Memory and Brain Wellness Center at Harborview

body.value:
Diagnostic services, treatment, and resources for people with degenerative brain disorders

Located at Harborview Medical Center, the clinical team at UW Medicine Memory and Brain Wellness Center understands the impact that neurodegenerative disorders can have on our patients and their families, and we’re dedicated to your support from initial consultation through treatment and comprehensive follow-up care. Our physicians, neuropsychologists, nurse practitioner and social worker specialize in evaluating patients whose symptoms may arise from Alzheimer disease, frontotemporal degeneration, vascular brain injury, Lewy body dementia or other conditions. Our team helps patients discover ways to use their strengths to promote brain health and overall well-being.

The Memory and Brain Wellness Center unites:

  • The UW Medicine Memory and Brain Wellness Clinic, which offers expert diagnosis, treatment and ongoing support, as well as primary care provider training for best practices for dementia diagnosis and care.
  • The Memory and Brain Wellness Center Community Education and Impact Program, which works to expand dementia support services across the state and offers seminars, programs and resources for persons living with memory loss.
  • The UW Alzheimer’s Disease Research Center -- one of 32 Alzheimer’s disease research resource centers funded through the NIH -- seeks to advance research in genetic risk and discover novel therapeutics that can be tailored an individual’s disease. We also connect interested individuals to clinical trials and observational studies.
body.processed:
Diagnostic services, treatment, and resources for people with degenerative brain disorders

Located at Harborview Medical Center, the clinical team at UW Medicine Memory and Brain Wellness Center understands the impact that neurodegenerative disorders can have on our patients and their families, and we’re dedicated to your support from initial consultation through treatment and comprehensive follow-up care. Our physicians, neuropsychologists, nurse practitioner and social worker specialize in evaluating patients whose symptoms may arise from Alzheimer disease, frontotemporal degeneration, vascular brain injury, Lewy body dementia or other conditions. Our team helps patients discover ways to use their strengths to promote brain health and overall well-being.

The Memory and Brain Wellness Center unites:

  • The UW Medicine Memory and Brain Wellness Clinic, which offers expert diagnosis, treatment and ongoing support, as well as primary care provider training for best practices for dementia diagnosis and care.
  • The Memory and Brain Wellness Center Community Education and Impact Program, which works to expand dementia support services across the state and offers seminars, programs and resources for persons living with memory loss.
  • The UW Alzheimer’s Disease Research Center -- one of 32 Alzheimer’s disease research resource centers funded through the NIH -- seeks to advance research in genetic risk and discover novel therapeutics that can be tailored an individual’s disease. We also connect interested individuals to clinical trials and observational studies.

body.value:
World-class treatment for brain, spine and nerve disorders

Located at UW Medical Center, the Neurological Surgery Clinic is an international leader and pioneer in the care and treatment of patients with diseases and disorders of the brain, spine and peripheral nerves.

We take a comprehensive and multidisciplinary approach to complex neurosurgical problems such as tumors, degenerative disease, vascular lesions, epilepsy, spinal anomalies, peripheral nerve disorders, chronic pain and spasticity, movement disorders and developmental defects.

Our patients receive uncompromising care in one of the most advanced facilities in the world.

body.value:
Your care first—now and always at Harborview

Adults 18 and older can find a great doctor at the Adult Medicine Clinic at Harborview. Conveniently located in the First Hill neighborhood, the clinic offers comprehensive wellness care and treatment for acute and chronic illnesses.

Internal medicine doctors, called internists, focus on prevention, diagnosis and treatment of acute and chronic diseases and illnesses in adults. These practitioners may also serve as primary care physicians.

Our clinic is supported by a team of professionals with expertise in mental health care, social work, chemical dependency, nutrition, clinical pharmacy, women's health issues and patient education. Our mental health care specialists at the Adult Medicine Clinic provide psychiatric consultations, medication management and recommendations for continued psychiatric care.

The care team accepts most major insurance plans. Make your appointment today.

body.value:
Expert neurological diagnostic and treatment in north Seattle

Located adjacent to Northwest Hospital & Medical Center in the McMurray Medical Building, Northwest Neurology expertly diagnoses and treats conditions and disorders of the nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, nerves and muscles.

We are a regional leader in the delivery of neurological care, providing individualized, state-of-the-art diagnostic investigation and treatment for patients throughout the Puget Sound region.

Our medical team specializes in providing timely and effective treatments and procedures intended to improve each patient’s quality of life.
body.processed:

We are a regional leader in the delivery of neurological care, providing individualized, state-of-the-art diagnostic investigation and treatment for patients throughout the Puget Sound region.

Our medical team specializes in providing timely and effective treatments and procedures intended to improve each patient’s quality of life.

body.value:
Complete diagnostic services for head and neck vessel issues

Located in the main hospital, the Cerebrovascular Lab at Harborview Medical Center offers ultrasound testing that helps physicians diagnose and treat diseases and disorders related to blood flow in the vessels of the head and neck.

Our neurosurgeons have a combination of ability, knowledge and experience that is unparalleled in the region. They offer a full spectrum of tests to assess any cerebrovascular disease or injury.

In addition, our sonographers are trained in the latest cerebrovascular ultrasound technologies, and each one has achieved the designation of Registered Vascular Technologist from the American Registry of Diagnostic Medical Sonography.

In addition, our sonographers are trained in the latest cerebrovascular ultrasound technologies, and each one has achieved the designation of Registered Vascular Technologist from the American Registry of Diagnostic Medical Sonography.

body.value:
Comprehensive, compassionate outpatient brain disease treatment

Located at Harborview Medical Center, the Gamma Knife Center is dedicated to making your treatment as comfortable as possible.

Gamma Knife radiosurgery is a noninvasive or minimally invasive outpatient treatment. It is an option for some patients with conditions that would typically require brain surgery or whole-brain radiation. It is used to treat blood vessel problems, such as arteriovenous malformations (AVMs), and brain tumors, including acoustic neuromas, meningioma, pituitary tumors, cancers that originate in the brain and cancerous lesions that have metastasized from distant areas of the body.

We can often schedule you for consult and treatment using the latest Gamma Knife Icon system, which uses both mask- and frame-based options, within 1-2 weeks, and we expedite appointments for urgent situations.

body.value:
Comprehensive care for neurosurgical conditions

The Neurological Surgery Clinic is located in the Ninth and Jefferson Building at Harborview Medical Center. It provides comprehensive assessment and management of neurological conditions, including acute vascular anomalies, brain tumors, aneurysms, movement disorders and diseases of the nervous system.

The clinic is staffed by attending physicians who evaluate patients for advanced elective procedures and diagnostic studies.

Attending physicians and neurosurgery residents evaluate post-surgical and post-trauma patients during a weekly clinic each Wednesday.

Attending physicians and neurosurgery residents evaluate post-surgical and post-trauma patients during a weekly clinic each Wednesday.

body.value:
Comprehensive treatment for neurological disorders

The Neurology Clinic at UW Medical Center cares for patients referred for conditions of the central and peripheral nervous systems, including neuromuscular diseases.

We offer comprehensive consultation, evaluation and treatment services for adults with neurological disorders. We treat a variety of neurological conditions, including muscle weakness, multiple sclerosis, epilepsy, Parkinson's disease, neuropathy, movement disorders and dizziness.

Our clinic is staffed by board-certified and board-eligible neurologists, who offer neurodiagnostic services including EEGs, EMGs, evoked potentials and autonomic nervous system testing.

attributes.title: Neurology Clinic at Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
Specialized neurological treatments for eastside patients

Conveniently located in Bellevue, the Neurology Clinic at the Eastside Specialty Center cares for patients referred for conditions of the central and peripheral nervous systems and muscle diseases.

We treat a variety of neurological conditions, including muscle weakness, multiple sclerosis, epilepsy, Parkinson’s disease, neuropathy, chronic headache, movement disorders and dizziness.

Our clinic is staffed by experienced neurologists, who offer neurodiagnostic services, including EEGs, evoked potentials and autonomic nervous system testing.

body.value:
Neurological diagnostic testing

Located at Harborview Medical Center, the EEG & Neurophysiology Lab is part of the UW Medicine Regional Epilepsy Center and Neurology Clinic.

The lab provides electroencephalography and related diagnostic testing services on a provider-referral basis.

body.value:
Specialized care for headaches 

The Headache Clinic at UWMC-Roosevelt in Seattle’s University District treats migraine and other headache disorders with an approach that places the emphasis on you -- the whole person.

Our team includes the only board-certified headache specialist in Washington state. They will help you manage your headaches and improve your quality of life with a multimodal and personalized treatment plan that focuses on  good sleep, nutrition, exercise and stress reduction. Therapies may include BOTOX, SPG, CEFALY and gammaCore.

body.value:
Centrally located treatment for neurological disorders

Located in the Norm Maleng Building across from the main hospital at Harborview Medical Center, the Neurology Clinic treats patients referred for disorders of the central and peripheral nervous systems, including seizure disorders, peripheral neuropathies and other neurological diseases.

Our services include neurological assessment and recommendations for treatment.

body.value:
Complete services for those suffering complex seizure problems

Located at Harborview Medical Center, the UW Medicine Regional Epilepsy Center comprises specialists trained in neurology, neurosurgery, neuroradiology and neuropsychology. The Center treats patients over the age of 13 and coordinates care with Seattle Children's Hospital for younger patients. 

We collaborate with a support staff of nurses, social workers, vocational rehabilitation specialists and electrodiagnostic technicians to diagnose and treat difficult seizure problems.

Our nationally-renowned facility works with referring physicians throughout the Northwest and across the country to diagnose and treat all types of seizure disorders.

Our nationally-renowned facility works with referring physicians throughout the Northwest and across the country to diagnose and treat all types of seizure disorders.

body.value:
Comprehensive stroke prevention and treatment

The Stroke Clinic at Harborview Medical Center cares for patients with cerebrovascular disease who have suffered a stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) or who are at risk for stroke or TIA.

We focus on primary and secondary stroke prevention, and our goals include reducing the incidence of stroke through identification and control of stroke risk factors, reducing morbidity and mortality of a stroke through emergency care for patients with acute stroke, diagnostic services, treatment options and a comprehensive rehabilitation program. 

As part of the first Joint Commission-certified Comprehensive Stroke Center in Washington State, we are proud to be recognized for consistently providing the highest standards of stroke care, from diagnosis to rehabilitation, and for serving as a center for clinical discovery in stroke prevention and treatment.

We treat more than 800 stroke patients annually, and individual care plans are based on an initial evaluation that may include a complete medical history and physical examination, stroke-risk and lifestyle education, and ancillary tests.

body.value:
Neuropsychological testing for cognitive and behavioral healthcare

Located at Harborview Medical Center, the Neuropsychological Assessment Services accepts referrals for outpatient neuropsychological assessments. These assessments typically check cognition function and behavior and can also include examining the effects of brain injury.

Neuropsychological testing can be beneficial for people with Alzheimer's disease and dementia. Aspects of cognitive functioning that are assessed typically include orientation, memory, intelligence, language, visuoperception and executive function. Clinical assessments also focus on psychological, personal, interpersonal and wider contextual circumstances.

Please contact us for questions about neuropsychological assessments and to learn how we can help you.

attributes.title: Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Head and neck surgery and comprehensive audiology diagnosis and treatment at Harborview

Located at Harborview Medical Center, our specialty clinic assesses and treats patients with routine and complex disorders, conditions and cancers of the ear, nose, throat and related structures of the head and neck. 

Our highly-trained surgeons, speech pathologists, nurses and support staff work hard to provide each patient with individualized treatment and information to support the healthiest outcome possible.

We also provide diagnosis and treatment for voice and swallowing conditions, sleep surgery, and complete audiology services, including diagnostic hearing evaluations and advanced hearing aid technology.

Head and neck surgery and comprehensive audiology diagnosis and treatment at Harborview

We also provide diagnosis and treatment for voice and swallowing conditions, sleep surgery, and complete audiology services, including diagnostic hearing evaluations and advanced hearing aid technology.

body.value:
Surgical care of the highest standard, conveniently located in North Seattle

Surgical Services & Hernia Center is the leader in advanced surgical services for the Seattle community and beyond, offering the latest in a variety of minimally invasive treatment options, including the da Vinci Si Robotic Surgical System.

Our board-certified surgeons have extensive experience and a track record of surgical excellence, and our care extends beyond the operating table. Every service we provide in our newly expanded and enhanced surgical facility is personalized to fit each patient's unique needs, and partnerships are an integral aspect of the care plans we design with our patients.

body.value:
Comprehensive treatment and prevention of kidney stones at Northwest Hospital

The Kidney Stone Center at Northwest Hospital & Medical Center was the first comprehensive center for the treatment and prevention of kidney stones in the Puget Sound region.

Our multidisciplinary team of experts in urology, nephrology and nutrition cares for patients suffering from acute or recurrent kidney stones. By unifying services in a single location, we deliver better and more efficient care at every phase of treatment and prevention of this painful condition.

We treat kidney stones using the latest minimally invasive surgical and nonsurgical procedures, and we use state-of-the-art tools such as holmium lasers and specialized ultrasonic and ultrasound equipment.
body.processed:
Comprehensive treatment and prevention of kidney stones at Northwest Hospital

body.value:
Research-backed, individualized testing for male fertility evaluation

The Male Fertility Lab is a full-service clinical andrology laboratory, providing patients and care providers with state-of-the-art testing for male infertility that’s tailored to achieve the best outcomes for individual needs.

Male infertility is caused by a variety of problems and having a complete and accurate diagnosis is essential to determining the most appropriate course of treatment. We specialize in analysis, sperm function tests, sperm retrieval and preparation and sperm freezing. We offer advanced tests you won’t find elsewhere, such as computerized sperm analysis, comet assay for sperm DNA fragmentation, hyperactivation, acrosome reaction, electron microscopy, reactive oxygen species and more. Our tests and procedures are backed by published studies so you get validated, meaningful results.

Established in 1979, the Male Fertility Lab serves physicians, clinics and patients throughout UW Medicine, Seattle, the Puget Sound area and Washington state, and is affiliated with private IVF programs and the Seattle Cancer Care Alliance.

Make an appointment via the Men's Health Center, or call 206-598-6358. For immediate fertility preservation help, call 206-314-5268. For more information, read this document or print a requisition form.

attributes.title: Urology Clinic at Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
Complete prostate oncology, general and specialty urology care in Bellevue

The Urology Clinic at Eastside Specialty Center in Bellevue offers complete urology care for patients from throughout the region by nationally recognized doctors. Urology disorders can be among the most uncomfortable, inconvenient and embarrassing of health issues, but many can be helped by awareness and prevention.

Managed early, many problems can be treated non-surgically or with minimally invasive techniques. New methods and tools constantly improve outcomes and the patient experience.

Our healthcare professionals, including urologists and nurse practitioners, help patients make informed lifestyle and medical choices about their urological disorders.

In addition to general urology, urinary voiding infection problems and urologic pain, this clinic evaluates and treats kidney stones, urogynecologic issues, infertility, sexual problems (including erectile dysfunction) and cancers of the prostate, kidney, bladder, testis or penis.

In many cases our urologists are also involved in cutting-edge research to offer superior treatment and care options.​​​

body.value:
Dignified, caring treatment for urologic disorders in Mountlake Terrace

The Urology Northwest clinic in Mountlake Terrace provides surgical and nonsurgical care for urologic disorders—one of the most uncomfortable, inconvenient and embarrassing health issues.

For more than 30 years we’ve offered specialized, customized patient treatments, the resources you need to make informed health decisions—including information about preventing urologic disorders— and informative and supportive follow-up care.

Our staff values spending time with patients so they feel cared for and understood, and we’re committed to preserving your dignity and providing the highest quality care and comfort.

body.value: The Cardiac Fitness Center is a contemporary, well-equipped facility that hosts Northwest Hospital's Cardiac Rehabilitation Program, which helps support recovery for cardiac patients, reduce risk for further cardiovascular disease, and increase overall health, fitness, and well-being.
body.processed: The Cardiac Fitness Center is a contemporary, well-equipped facility that hosts Northwest Hospital's Cardiac Rehabilitation Program, which helps support recovery for cardiac patients, reduce risk for further cardiovascular disease, and increase overall health, fitness, and well-being.

body.value:
Nervous system testing and analysis for personalized treatment

The Neurodiagnostic Lab at UW Medical Center provides electroencephalography and related diagnostic testing services on a provider-referral basis.

Available neurodiagnostic tests are electroencephalograms (EEGs), evoked potentials (visual, auditory, somatosensory, electroretinograms (ERGs), electro-oculograms (EOGs) and autonomic testing, including heart rate variability, valsalva maneuver, heart rate response to deep breathing, tilt table and quantitative sudomotor axon reflex testing (QSART).

Many medications should be avoided before autonomic testing. Consult with your provider before your visit.

Many medications should be avoided before autonomic testing. Consult with your provider before your visit.
